publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-417 Tommy Sheridan: General Pinochet—That the Parliament notes with deep concern that the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, "is minded" not to proceed with the extradition of General Pinochet on the grounds that he would be unfit to stand trial now or at any time in the future; believes that this flies in the face of the human rights of the victims of torture under General Pinochet’s military regime and their relatives who need justice to be done, and calls upon the Home Secretary to agree to extradite General Pinochet to Spain. Supported by: Dennis Canavan*, Alex Neil*
S1M-417 General Pinochet (lodged on 12 January 2000) Shona Robison*, Scott Barrie*

S1M-417 Tommy Sheridan: General Pinochet—That the Parliament notes with deep concern that the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, "is minded" not to proceed with the extradition of General Pinochet on the grounds that he would be unfit to stand trial now or at any time in the future; believes that this flies in the face of the human rights of the victims of torture under General Pinochet’s military regime and their relatives who need justice to be done, and calls upon the Home Secretary to agree to extradite General Pinochet to Spain. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Scott Barrie
S1M-417 General Pinochet (lodged on 12 January 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-417 General Pinochet (lodged on 12 January 2000) Kay Ullrich*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-417 General Pinochet (lodged on 12 January 2000) Ms Margaret Curran*, Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-417 Tommy Sheridan: General Pinochet—That the Parliament notes with deep concern that the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, "is minded" not to proceed with the extradition of General Pinochet on the grounds that he would be unfit to stand trial now or at any time in the future; believes that this flies in the face of the human rights of the victims of torture under General Pinochet’s military regime and their relatives who need justice to be done, and calls upon the Home Secretary to agree to extradite General Pinochet to Spain. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Scott Barrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Linda Fabiani, Kay Ullrich, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Margaret Curran, Cathy Jamieson
S1M-417 General Pinochet (lodged on 12 January 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-417 General Pinochet (lodged on 12 January 2000) Fiona McLeod*, Hugh Henry*
S1M-417 General Pinochet (lodged on 12 January 2000) Christine Grahame*

S1M-417 Tommy Sheridan: General Pinochet—That the Parliament notes with deep concern that the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, "is minded" not to proceed with the extradition of General Pinochet on the grounds that he would be unfit to stand trial now or at any time in the future; believes that this flies in the face of the human rights of the victims of torture under General Pinochet’s military regime and their relatives who need justice to be done, and calls upon the Home Secretary to agree to extradite General Pinochet to Spain. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Scott Barrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Linda Fabiani, Kay Ullrich, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Margaret Curran, Cathy Jamieson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fiona McLeod, Hugh Henry, Christine Grahame
S1M-417 General Pinochet (lodged on 12 January 2000) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-417 Tommy Sheridan: General Pinochet—That the Parliament notes with deep concern that the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, "is minded" not to proceed with the extradition of General Pinochet on the grounds that he would be unfit to stand trial now or at any time in the future; believes that this flies in the face of the human rights of the victims of torture under General Pinochet’s military regime and their relatives who need justice to be done, and calls upon the Home Secretary to agree to extradite General Pinochet to Spain. Supported by: Dennis Canavan, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Scott Barrie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Linda Fabiani, Kay Ullrich, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Margaret Curran, Cathy Jamieson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fiona McLeod, Hugh Henry, Christine Grahame, Ms Sandra White
